page.title: 16BUCKLAND CHURCH DARTMOOR
page.content: { 12th.Cent.} South wall of nave,South door,font.{13th.Cent.}Chancel.{15th. {Cent.}Tower,Rood screen.{16th.Cent.} North aisle. Carved bosses on wagon roof depict flowers,pattern and heads. Staircases lead to tower and rood screen. West side paintings on screen show visit of Magi and Annunciation.On East side man with turban may indicate influence of Crusades.Other paintings outlined in black (unique).{1700}5 bells.Other 3 added by Mr. Whitley in {1928.}In the same year he donated the tower clock. The numerals were replaced with 'MY DEAR MOTHER'.It was wound by hand until electrified in{1978.}Tower floor contains red Medieval tiles.The earliest legible tombstone in floor of church dated{1593.}World War One Memorial has l3 names.World War Two Memorial in porch has 4 names.
